course.title: MAT 4175 Introduction to Mathematical Statistics (3 units)
course.desc: Limit theorems. Sampling distributions. Parametric estimation. Concepts of sufficiency and efficiency. Neyman-Pearson paradigm, likelihood ratio tests. Parametric and non-parametric methods for two- sample comparisons. Notions of experimental design, categorical data analysis, the general linear model, decision theory and Bayesian inference. Previously MAT 3175.Course Component: LecturePrerequisites: MAT 2375, (MAT 2121 or MAT 2122), (MAT 2141 or MAT 2342).
